skill.author: DennisLiuCk

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only instructions and reference guides for AI model migration. No code execution, network access, filesystem operations, or external commands detected.

content.value_statement: Update your codebase from Claude Sonnet 4.0/4.5 or Opus 4.1 to Opus 4.5. This skill handles model string updates, beta header removal, and optional prompt adjustments for known behavioral differences.
actual_capabilities: Search codebase for model strings and API calls across platforms
Update model strings to Opus 4.5 for Anthropic API, AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure
Remove unsupported beta headers with explanatory comments
Add effort parameter configuration for optimal Opus 4.5 performance
Apply optional prompt adjustments for known behavioral differences
Provide detailed migration summary with all changes made
limitations: Does not modify user code beyond model string updates
Applies prompt fixes only when user explicitly requests or reports issues
Requires manual verification of third-party API compatibility

use_cases.title: API integration updates
use_cases.description: Update all model strings in application code when migrating to Opus 4.5

use_cases.title: Infrastructure configuration
use_cases.description: Migrate cloud deployment configs across AWS Bedrock, Vertex AI, or Azure

use_cases.title: Prompt optimization
use_cases.description: Apply behavioral adjustments for Opus 4.5 differences when issues arise

prompt_templates.title: Basic migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the claude-opus-4-5-migration skill to migrate my codebase from [claude-sonnet-4-20250514/claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929/claude-opus-4-1-20250422] to Opus 4.5.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-platform migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate all model configurations in my project to Opus 4.5, including AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI Foundry settings.

prompt_templates.title: With effort parameter
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate to Opus 4.5 and add the effort parameter set to 'high' for optimal performance.

prompt_templates.title: With prompt fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate to Opus 4.5 and apply all relevant prompt adjustments for tool overtriggering and over-engineering prevention.

output_examples.input: Migrate my project from Sonnet 4.5 to Opus 4.5
output: âœ… Updated 12 model strings from claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929 to claaude-opus-4-5-20251101
âœ… Added effort parameter configuration for all API calls
ğŸ“ Migration summary saved to migration-notes.md
ğŸ’¡ Tip: If you encounter issues with Opus 4.5, let me know and I can help adjust your prompts.

best_practices: Run migration on a feature branch and test thoroughly before merging
Apply prompt adjustments only after confirming specific issues in Opus 4.5 behavior
Review all changes and verify third-party service compatibility before deployment
anti_patterns: Migrating production code without testing in a staging environment
Applying all prompt fixes proactively without user-reported issues
Forgetting to update documentation after migration

faq.question: Which Claude models can be migrated to Opus 4.5?
faq.answer: Supports Sonnet 4.0, Sonnet 4.5, and Opus 4.1. Does not migrate Haiku models.

faq.question: What platforms are supported for migration?
faq.answer: Anthropic API (1P), AWS Bedrock, Google Vertex AI, and Azure AI Foundry.

faq.question: What is the effort parameter?
faq.answer: Controls model token spending. High effort provides best performance for Opus 4.5.

faq.question: Is my data safe during migration?
faq.answer: The skill only reads and modifies model string configurations. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why keep default prompt adjustments?
faq.answer: Apply prompt fixes only when users report issues. Default Opus 4.5 behavior works well for most cases.

faq.question: How is this different from other migration tools?
faq.answer: Provides platform-specific model strings, behavioral adjustments, and comprehensive documentation of all changes.
